newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan approves US$60.653 mln in China investments.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan approves US$60.653 mln in China investments.

text.p: Taiwan's economics ministry said on Saturday it had approved 15 new investment projects worth US$60.653 million for China.
The ministry agreed to let shipping giant Evergreen Marine invest US$5.5 million in cargo loading and distribution business in the mainland, it said in a statement.
It also approved car parts maker Tong Yang Industry to invest US$8 million, US$5.3 million and US$2.7 million, respectively, in three car parts venture in China, it said.

Though all investments in China must be government approved and routed indirectly through Hong Kong or other third places, Taiwan remains concerned that its economy may become too dependent on China -- and hence politically vulnerable.
Taiwan has banned all direct official contact with China since the end of the Chinese civil war in 1949.
Despite the ban, indirect commerce has flourished since the late 1980s when political tensions started to thaw.
Some 30,000 Taiwan companies have poured more than US$30 billion into China so far.
